questions.question: What is the primary purpose of powerful launchers?
options: To send light payloads on short flights around Earth
To carry heavy payloads into space and perform manned and scientific missions to distant places
To be used for pilot training flights
To generate alternative energy for power stations on Earth

questions.question: What is the main problem that powerful launchers solve?
options: Inability to fly planes outside the atmosphere
Difficulty in guiding satellites into precise orbits
Inability to launch heavy payloads and reach large distances in space
Need to save materials for building satellites

questions.question: Why is the fairing (nosecone) released during launch?
options: To make room for the astronauts
To reduce weight and optimize the mission
To test the stability of the launcher
To change engines midway

questions.question: What is the main role of propulsion systems in spacecraft?
options: To maintain internal heat inside the spacecraft
To allow movement, change of direction and speed in space
To store supplies for astronauts
To operate communication systems

questions.question: Why is a propulsion system needed in space?
options: Because there is friction in space that requires slowing down
Because there is no power supply in space
Because there is no air or friction in space, so thrust is needed to move
To operate the spacecraft's main computer

questions.question: Which type of propulsion is particularly suitable for long missions?
options: Electric propulsion
Mechanical propulsion
Solar-only propulsion
Wind-based propulsion

questions.question: What is the main purpose of communication in space? Which waves are used for space communication?
options: Sound waves
Radio waves
Light waves only
Water waves

questions.question: Why is it impossible to communicate in space by sound?
options: Because sound weakens at high altitude
Because there is too much noise in space
Because there is no air in space to transmit sound
Because the speed of sound in space is too high

questions.question: How do life-support systems help save resources in space?
options: By using very little rocket fuel
By recycling water and air
By reducing the spacecraftâ€™s speed
By only using electric engines

questions.question: What is the main purpose of life-support systems in space?
options: To provide speed and rockets for the spacecraft
To allow astronauts to survive and stay healthy in the extreme conditions of space
To launch satellites into space
To measure radiation from stars

questions.question: Which of the following is NOT part of life-support systems in space?
options: Temperature and pressure regulation
Production of oxygen and removal of carbon dioxide
Removing waste (dirt)
Launching additional spacecraft

questions.question: What is the main purpose of landing solutions in space?
options: To accelerate the spacecraft to a higher speed
To ensure the spacecraft lands safely and in a controlled way on ground or water
To measure gravity on other stars
To send additional spacecraft into the air

questions.question: Why are life-support systems essential for astronauts on long-term missions?
options: Because they allow launching additional spacecraft
Because they maintain health, a safe environment, and proper functioning over time
Because they protect the spacecraft from meteor impacts
Because they enable communication with ground stations
